channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Palace: Duque's 'flattened' COVID-19 curve remark a case of word choice mistake
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Health Secretary Francisco Duque III did not get a dressing down from President Duterte for claiming that the Philippines has flattened the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) curve, a remark that he immediately took back after drawing widespread criticism.

item.title: PNP building more quarantine, testing hubs amid 59 new COVID-19 cases
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: The Philippines is still enduring the longest quarantine in the world.

item.title: 2,498 new cases push Philippines’ COVID-19 tally to 61,266
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: The country has been experiencing a surge in coronavirus infections following the further easing of quarantine measures.

item.title: Peasant groups wary of potential abuse in 'Oplan Kalinga'
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: "All the IATF can think of are militarist solutions to the pandemic. That is the problem with military men and ex-generals sitting in the government. Their military mindset is getting in the way of more effective and pro-people solutions to the health crisis."

item.title: Citing 'chilling effect' on workers’ rights, labor groups file petition vs anti-terror law
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: The labor groups said the anti-terrorism law is unconstitutional for being “vague and overly broad” in its definition and language, “violating in the process the people’s right to due process.”

item.title: After Sotto confirms SONA at Batasan, Palace says unsure if Duterte will deliver address from Congress
item.description: "The venue is confirmed, it is Batasan. But from what I know, it's not yet 100% sure if the president will physically attend of if he will broadcast from [Malago Clubhouse in Malacañang] to Congress," Roque said said in a mix of English and Filipino during Thursday's Palace briefing.

item.title: DepEd: Classes will open on August 24 ‘whatever form it is’
item.description: Classes will open next month utilizing various alternatives to traditional in-person interactions such as online classes, printed modules and instruction delivered through radio and television.

item.title: Bongbong Marcos denies tapping Cambridge Analytica for 'rebranding,' hints at legal action
item.author: Bella Perez-Rubio
item.description: This is not the first time the Marcos family has been accused of attempting to revise history.

item.title: 'Late night with Duterte': Announcement of new quarantine status comes as previous classifications expire
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte previously announced fresh quarantine measures days before they were expected to take effect.

item.title: Layoffs start end- August for ABS-CBN
item.author: Richmond Mercurio
item.description: After being denied a new franchise, media giant ABS-CBN Corp. will start laying off its workers on Aug. 31.
